value:
SELECT
  category,
  type,
  COUNT(*) as num_crimes
FROM
  cross_join
GROUP BY
  ROLLUP(category, type)
LIMIT
  10

value.name: (DrillDown) Total crimes in a city in a year
(Iceberg) Neighbourhoods in Denver with highest theft
(Iceberg) Neighbourhoods with most number of severe crimes
(RollUp) Crime severity rolled up by date
(RollUp) Crime severity rolled up by location
(RollUp) Crimes rolled up by crime type

value:
SELECT
  province,
  city,
  neighbourhood,
  AVG(severity) AS severity
FROM
  cross_join
GROUP BY
  ROLLUP(province, city, neighbourhood)
LIMIT
  10

SELECT
  year,
  month,
  day_of_the_month,
  AVG(severity) AS severity
FROM
  cross_join
GROUP BY
  ROLLUP(year, month, day_of_the_month)
LIMIT
  10

-- The 'GROUP BY' is added to visualize
-- the slice
SELECT
  'pie' as type,
  COUNT(*) as y,
  '# of crimes' as y_label,
  city as x,
  'City' as x_label
FROM
  cross_join
WHERE
  month = { month | 2 }
  AND year = { year | 2016 }
GROUP BY
  city

SELECT
  *
FROM
  (
    SELECT
      'bar' as type,
      neighbourhood as x,
      'Neighbourhood' as x_label,
      COUNT(*) :: float / 1000 as y,
      '# of crimes (in thousands)' as y_label
    FROM
      cross_join
    WHERE
      city = { city | Denver }
      AND category = { category | Larceny }
    GROUP BY
      neighbourhood
  ) AS r
WHERE
  r.y >= { count threshold | 0.8 }
ORDER BY
  r.y DESC

SELECT
  'bar' as type,
  AVG(count) as y,
  neighbourhood as x,
  'Neighbourhood' as x_label,
  'Average monthly crime rate' as y_label
FROM(
    SELECT
      COUNT(*),
      month,
      neighbourhood
    FROM
      cross_join
    WHERE
      neighbourhood != ''
    GROUP BY
      (neighbourhood, month)
  ) AS r
GROUP BY
  neighbourhood

SELECT
  COUNT(*) AS num_crimes,
  MIN(year) AS year,
  MIN(city) AS city
FROM
  cross_join
WHERE
  year = { year | 2016 }
  AND city = { city | Vancouver }

SELECT
  COUNT(*) OVER (PARTITION BY neighbourhood) AS neighbourhood_crime_rate,
  *
FROM
  cross_join
WHERE
  neighbourhood != ''
LIMIT
  10

SELECT
  *
FROM
  (
    SELECT
      'bar' as type,
      neighbourhood AS x,
      COUNT(*) :: float / 1000 AS y,
      '# of crimes (in thousands)' as y_label
    FROM
      cross_join
    WHERE
      severity > 10
      AND neighbourhood != ''
    GROUP BY
      neighbourhood
  ) AS r
WHERE
  r.y > { count threshold | 1.2 }
ORDER BY
  r.y DESC

-- Location dimension is sliced by city
SELECT
  'bar' as type,
  neighbourhood as x,
  'Neighbourhoods' as x_label,
  COUNT(*) :: float / 1000 as y,
  '# of crimes (in thousands)' as y_label
FROM
  cross_join
WHERE
  city = { city | Denver }
GROUP by
  neighbourhood
